channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12452] Add regular expression based split policy
item.description:
The current DelimitedKeyPrefixRegionSplitPolicy split policy is not flexible enough to describe the split point prefix in some case. A regex based split policy is proposed, for example:
^[^\x00]\x00[^\x00]\x00
means the split point will always be truncated to a prefix at the second \0 char.

The binary string support is quite useful when the rowkey encoded by a common data access library instead of concatenated manually by application developer.
item.summary: Add regular expression based split policy

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
A custom RegionSplitPolicy implementing a SplitPolicy that groups rows by a prefix of the
row-key. The prefix is chosen according to regular expression match.

This ensures that a region is not split "inside" a prefix of a row key. I.e. rows can be
co-located in a region by their prefix.

As an example, if you have row keys formatted as <code>salt_userid_enventtype_eventid</code>,
and you want to split rows between <code>userids</code>. This split policy can be
represents as a regex like <code>^[^_]+_[^_]+_</code> (suppose all parts are non empty and
does not contain '_'). For the regex string, ISO-8859-1 character set is used so any byte array
can be supported, for example, <code>^[^\x00]+\x00[^\x00]+\x00</code> split after the second
<code>\x00</code> character.
